channel.title: A solution for people who need to portforward (kaspersky people only)
channel.description:
ok u kno i was wondering and tryin to think y my server wont go up...but then, i thought of firewall! but my firewall was off..so i thought of like what could be wrong then..i open kaspersky then thought it could be the problem! now here's what u do in order to allow kaspersky to forward the 43594 port!
open kaspersky then on the top right there is "settings" click that then on the middle left u will find "network" click network u will now c somethin like "monitor selected ports only" click on select, then add the port 43594 and for description anything... then click apply..ok..and ur done! now try and it should work:S it did for me![br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 01, 2009, 02:39:16 pm[/size][hr]oh and this is on kaspersky 2009..i donno if other versions could be diff :D

item.title: A solution for people who need to portforward (kaspersky people only)
item.dc:creator: @danimaster danimaster
item.description:
@danimaster wrote:

ok u kno i was wondering and tryin to think y my server wont go up…but then, i thought of firewall! but my firewall was off…so i thought of like what could be wrong then…i open kaspersky then thought it could be the problem! now here’s what u do in order to allow kaspersky to forward the 43594 port!

open kaspersky
then on the top right there is “settings” click that
then on the middle left u will find “network” click network
u will now c somethin like “monitor selected ports only”
click on select, then add the port 43594 and for description anything…
then click apply…ok…and ur done!
now try and it should work:S it did for me![br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 01, 2009, 02:39:16 pm[/size][hr]oh and this is on kaspersky 2009…i donno if other versions could be diff

Read full topic
